objective: Understand the fundamental measurements used in physics.
content: S.I. units, scalers and vectors, and measurement techniques using vernier calipers and micrometers.
specific_objectives: List the basic S.I. units: kg, m, s, A, K, cd, mol
Distinguish between scalar and vector quantities
Calculate the resultant of two vectors (triangle and parallelogram method)
Explain how to use and read a vernier caliper and a micrometer screw gauge

objective: Analyze forces, motion, and energy transformations.
content: Newton's Laws of Motion, work, energy, power, and collisions.
specific_objectives: State and apply Newton's three laws of motion
Calculate displacement, velocity, and acceleration using equations of motion
Explain the concept of momentum and the law of conservation of linear momentum
Calculate Work (Fd), Kinetic Energy (1/2mv²), and Potential Energy (mgh)
Apply the principle of conservation of energy to physical systems
Differentiate between renewable and non-renewable energy sources

section: Section B: Thermal Physics and Kinetic Theory
objective: Understand the nature of heat and its effects on matter.
content: Thermometry, specific heat capacity, and the gas laws.
specific_objectives: Distinguish between heat and temperature
Explain the working of liquid-in-glass and thermocouple thermometers
Calculate heat energy using Q = mcΔθ and Q = ml
Describe the kinetic theory of matter and use it to explain pressure and temperature
Apply the gas laws (Boyle's, Charles', Pressure) and the combined gas law

objective: Analyze wave behavior and the properties of light.
content: Transverse vs longitudinal waves, reflection, refraction, and the electromagnetic spectrum.
specific_objectives: Distinguish between transverse and longitudinal waves
Calculate wave speed using v = fλ
Verify the laws of reflection and describe image formation in plane mirrors
Apply Snell's Law (n = sin i / sin r) and explain critical angle/total internal reflection
Explain the dispersion of white light into the spectrum
Identify the components and uses of the electromagnetic spectrum

objective: Analyze electrical circuits and the effects of magnetism.
content: Ohm's Law, circuit components, and electromagnetism.
specific_objectives: Define current, potential difference (voltage), and resistance
State and apply Ohm's Law (V = IR)
Calculate total resistance in series and parallel circuits
Explain the heating, chemical, and magnetic effects of an electric current
Describe the structure and use of transformers (step-up and step-down)

section: Section E: Atomic and Nuclear Physics
objective: Understand the structure of the atom and nuclear processes.
content: Atomic structure, isotopes, and radioactive decay (alpha, beta, gamma).
specific_objectives: Describe the structure of the atom (protons, neutrons, electrons)
Explain the concept of isotopes
Identify the properties of alpha particles, beta particles, and gamma rays
Explain the concept of half-life and solve simple decay problems
Discuss the uses and dangers of ionizing radiation
